title: So now that the Bilgewater lore event is live, I wanna say to the lore team...
body:
Thank you
{{sticker:galio-happy}} 

No really, I mean it. Going back over a place that we've already updated and had an event for may seem redundant to some, but to me it just breathes life even further into an already interesting character.
You didn't need to do it, but you did, and it's made the entire area more interesting as a result. 
I love the new Kench, Fizz, and Nautilus lore, and Pyke is an extremely interesting character as well.

All this passion that you put into this lore clearly shows, and it just makes this world feel so much more alive. I don't play League much anymore, but I still follow the lore, and this makes me very, very pleased for all the effort you put into it.

We're more than halfway done now with updating every champion, and the effort is paying off. I eagerly await the day when the lore is complete once more.

Good job guys.

replies.body:
I want to say that there are a lot more regions other than Pirate Bay.

This game is becoming more and more mono thematic both in terms of gameplay and now even in terms of Lore. I'm sorry I liked it in the first place.
Which region would you like us to update next?

Now I'm looking even worse by making any sort of request.

By the way the issue is the effort that Bilgewater gets rather the sheer number of events relating to it. We had an interactive 6 chapter story line, an Harrowing event, a comic and now the audio drama. It would be nice to have this sort of different media about a region Lore event.

If I could pick 2 I'd say Targon and Demacia (or Piltover) if I have to go by personal taste, the Freljord/Bandle City if  we want to bring up a region that seems to have beeen left alone more than others.
All noted. I'll see what I can do. ;-)

i'd love to see an update to noxus again, even tho they were updated earlier this year, since I love new Noxus and want to see some questions answered like who represents Guile, what is Black Rose really planning, who would order such a dangerous expedition to unearth a Darkin etc.

Personally Bandle City and continue the Shuriman lore.  We've been left on a cliffhanger for quite some time. And pls don't make Taliah be the main character,   let it be the battle of the demi-gods it should be, with Taliah and Sivir fighting off Xerath's army
IMO, Taliyah makes for a good POV, but not a good main character (in this story). Does that make sense?

> [{quoted}](name=Helixarrow,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=cPAhzm79,comment-id=0000000000070000,timestamp=2018-06-01T10:37:57.121+0000)

It does
The Freljord is the least-touched region by far. So...why not?

You mean besides the massive lore dump on the three sisters thing, the political marriage of Ashe and Tryndamere, Ornn and everything involving him, Olaf appearing in the last Bilgewater event, etc.

The two most untouched lore regions are Bandle City and Kumungu.
When did that happen? I haven't seen the Freljord included in anything for the past 4 years except for Gimli's role in the last Harrowing.
since then only one pieace of information was revealed, Lissandra's Frostguard were "masters of the Void". so everyone else in Freljord might be screwed soon!

Yeah so i doubt that equates to what Demacia, Noxus, Piltover, Zaun and most recently and extensively, Bilgewater has gotten.

A single lore piece compared to entire regional overhauls doesn't hold up too well as an argument.

And yes, Bandle City is even more undeveloped but to me, it's propably like some gnome-garden, similarily to what you'd see in fairy tales or in the Smurf cartoon at the beginning. Idk, maybe it's more compelling but all the Yordles are so goofy and stupidly carefree that you can do the "Masks his horrible past behind a smile" only so many times. I'm not really into that for a reason.

>A single lore piece compared to entire regional overhauls doesn't hold up too well as an argument.

I'm sorry for the confusion but thats not my argument at all. in fact im pointing out how baffled i am ,that we learned so little about Freljord after these years.

Freljord is the most interesting Region to me.its a mix of everything i ever liked. Viking's tribal life style, frozen landmarks, ancient secrets no one knows anything about. big scary beasts that takes a battalion of soldiers to kill and most importantly badass women who don't take nonesense from anyone and lead their tribes like its nobodies buisness!
it's sad to see its left out like this! 

> maybe it's more compelling but all the Yordles are so goofy and stupidly carefree that you can do the "Masks his horrible past behind a smile" only so many times. I'm not really into that for a reason.

Althought Bandle city is not my cup of tea either, i think it deserves a little attention as well exactly for the reasons you mentioned. so we learn something different and new about them instead of "Masks his horrible past behind a smile"

You replied as a second person after Terozu so i got confused on the points you're trying to make.

So i guess we're in an agreement.

One of the reasons i dislike Bandle City is cuz when you look at the Pentakill album cinematic with Mordekaiser and Kayle in it, they're stomping around in like this tiny Bandle City and that's pretty much how i imagine them - goofy, silly creatures who just run around having fun in some weird yet boring ways to make them look cuter.

Implementing depth into those characters is not an easy task to say the least. I have written stories with fantasy characters and not a single time did i use midgets or gnomes/dwarves in them as they almost always serve as comic relief. Ironically, Gnar's one of the more mysterious yordles as he has a Hulk-problem which is more terrifying than cute, fortunately.
Glad we cleared that confusion. and yes i see your point about bandle city. Gnar is certainly one of the interesting ones!

the political marriage and "massive lore dump" on three sisters was part of journal of justice which is scrapped and no longer canon...for now!

Olaf appearing in bilgwater isnt exactly a Freljord update so the only thing we got was Ornn.

aside from Ornn,among all other Freljord champions, Braum is the only character with a "3 minutes read" short story. so Freljord and Bandle city are outdated just the same. both need update. and according to scathlocke Kumungu isnt exactly a region yet!

my source of information is Freljord's Universe page which currently is the only official source of lore. see if you can find anything about the marriage or stories about three sisters there cause i couldn't.
The war between the sisters is still canon.  The marriage is suspect, but considering its based on the actual Tryndameres glfriend i think itll come back soon.

it is canon yes but no further information about it. we only know that they were there and they were at war and thats because of few mentions here and there in other character's stories. none of the massive lore dumps you mentioned made it to offical universe page sadly.

and the marriage being suspect isn't the case here. it's about the fact that Freljord got no actual lore update as a region since its release. 

you know whats worse? bandle city doesnt even have a short story about any of its characters! not even one so Bandle city still has it worse.

Kumungu isnt even called Kumungu anymore.

And we did get the short story where Lissandra herself sealed away the watchers which is extremely odd.

yeah i hope Nunu's VGU brings some new stories for Freljord as well and shed some light on turn of events. im a bit concerned about Bandle city though. we have no information about any upcoming champion or VGU for that area so Riot might have to just give Bandle city an update without a special occasion.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=cPAhzm79,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-05-31T20:00:50.767+0000)

I would love for yall to go more in depth with Mt. Targon... Maybe bring in some new tales or introduce a new champion from the outskirts.

And the fae... The only clues we have are with Lulu's lore and the thing in Annie's cinematic. Maybe that can be explained in Bandle City.
Icanthia and mroe about the Mage-Kings (I want a champ from there so a Watcher !)

Hey, I know its a long shot, but can you do something about that Darkins. I find them extremely interesting and their stories are still kinda shrouded beyond the 'pick up this weapon and you become a legendary warrior' and such. Its kind similar to Targon with {{champion:80}} and all. But generally I love the lore of this game, keep it up!
If you think Pantheon or Targon has any similarities to the Darkin beyond someone being a vessel, you know almost nothing about either faction.

I just said they are similar because they are vessels. Panth picked up a spear and become Pantheon and lost his 'humanity'. Kayn picked up the scythe or Varus picked up the bow and lost their free will and 'humanity'

Ummm no.  That is not how Atreus ascended.

And Kayn is still just as human as ever.  As is he free.
? In game he can turn into a Darkin, thats not human. And Atreus climbed the mountain of Targon and picked up a spear, no?

No.

Atreus ascended a mountain, was welcomed into Targon where his soul passed into the after life, and Pantheon inhabited the boys body with some of his power creating the avatar of war we see in game.

He did not 'pick' up a spear.  He just uses a Targonian spear.
No way. Aight then thanks, I thought Targon worked like the Darkin lore. My bad

Instead of working on area after area, can you provide a better framework (worldmap / timeline for events) and maybe consider moving away from only providing fragemented and short pieces of information? I think the lore can much more than just accompany new releases and create shortterm hype. Having a good grasp on the overall worldbuilding would also allow you to sell long stories as books or create other leaguelore related games.

The universe site is great but if you dive in it shatters into so many pieces, a very much unfinished puzzle, some stories feel like HP Lovecraft, and trying to tie the lore together i feel like the characters chasing shadows in Lovecrafts stories.
Freljord.

Glad you enjoyed it all! I think there's a false assumption that we pick regions to update based on our own preferences... when in fact, we are led to cover (and re-cover) certain areas because of the new champion releases...

Besides, there isn't a single region/faction in the lore that has been fully explored, yet. Plenty more to look at if we ever need to return to Bilgewater, too! :-)
Bandle City hasn't been fully explored. Neither has the big jungle on the southern continent.

Kumungu (!) isn't a region in the same way that Shurima or Demacia are, but we will totally get around to those big areas too. Like Ironspike, and the provinces of Ionia beyond Navori.

Bandle City... well, there's a mystery wrapped in an enigma... ;-)
Ahh nuts, your encryption is encrypted...
I'm really glad to hear that and I'm actually ok with bandle being a mystery .

Quick question in the realm of obscure lore regions, but have you retconned the Voodoo Isles?
I always loved the concept of that, a magically obfuscated place, somewhere which utterly devours any sense of normality.
I understand Ionia is a region like that, with thin barriers to the spirit realm, but that's ultimately very tangible and sensible.
It'd be nice to see an adaptation of the Voodoo Isles. :)
Lands... not isles... and im pretty sure that is not canon anymore

The reason why it feels a bit like you prefer Bilgewater is because the Bilgewater event is easily the biggest lore event of the year.

With the Butchers bridge returning,new skins to accompany the champ,new loot and the bilgewater champions getting color stories(unlike the other champs in the Noxus,Ionia and Void updates).

And before that,the other Bilgewater event is probably the biggest lore event that we ever had.

Right? It's awesome. Bilgewater has become my favorite region in the game with this update, as I love the idea of a culture based around lawlessness and monster hunting. Any random Bilgewater citizen could drop me easily, but I'd still go there because it's so cool. I love the ocean the the idea of a place where ocean horrors are real and serious forces is a dream come true. I just love the thematic. Before I really knew the lore and thought it was just pirate land I honestly found it a little boring, felt like they could do more than just pirates and a few weird things like Nautilus and Fizz, but now that they've focused those sorts of characters into sort of urban legends I feel like the place is a lot more cohesive and interesting.

Not a fan.

Can’t get invested in a story that changes itself every few months.
This makes no sense.

I used to know the lore of every champion, but every few months for the past year or so, they change the stories of champions and regions like they did with
Swain
Shurima
Zaun
Volibear upon Ornn’s Release
Yorick and the shadow isles

As I’ve said, being invested in a story that cannot stay the same is not appealing to me. But that’s just “muh opinion”

I can only take relaunching backstories a few times before I realize every detail of this lore is “subject to change”

The only things truly subject to change is whats to do with the old summoners stuff.

Retcons on lore like this take time.  Your complaints are basically, "You said you were gonna change shit and i dont like that now that its happening."

He is not mean about it and his opinion is valid so why downvote... there is a lot of retcon going on, my favorite would be yordles becoming the "immortal embodiment of virtues" instead of "furry hobbits"

I didnt downvote him.  What i said is no more 'Mean' than what he said.  And he posts this constantly across different posts.

Furthermore disagreeing is what the downvote button is for.
